result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey D Cage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. If revoked, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC; balance paid during extended supervision. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: - Full-time work, school or a combination.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- No further violations of the law.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey D Cage

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Plea and Sentencing ( 38 pages) commencing 07-13-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Defendant Corey D Cage in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Corey D Cage in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1, 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 years, consecutive to any other sentence, the term of initial confinement is 1 year, the term of extended supervision is 2 years. 

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 years, concurrent to Count 1, consecutive to any other sentence, the term of initial confinement is 1 year, the term of extended supervision is 3 years. 

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program
Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program 

Conditions of Extended Supervision
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- Full time work, school or a combination. 
- 60 hours of community service.
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, ( during term of probation. If revoked, ) out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a minimum of 6 months. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Corey D Cage not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Case calendared for Scheduling Conference this date.  Court in trial on another matter.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing May 4, 2022 at 1:30 pm.  bm
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 2.

Defendant Corey D Cage in court with Grace Hagerman, under the student practice rule, appeared with  Attorney  Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Corey D Cage in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
The parties appeared via zoom.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer William Mauch    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Corey D Cage in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Corey D Cage in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Corey D Cage appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
